abstract.text: Options for creating a least squares minimum residual method.

inlineContent.text: LSMR is a minimal residual (MINRES) method for solving least squares. Use LSMR to solve equations of the form
where an exact solution doesn’t exist. The returned solution minimizes ‖
Although LSMR is equivalent to applying MINRES to the normal equations
in exact arithmetic, it has superior numerical behavior and is the preferred method. Due to the implicit squaring of the condition of
in the normal equations, LSMR may struggle to converge in single precision. Use double-precision arithmetic where possible.
. For square, full-rank unsymmetric or indefinite equations, use

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Returns a conjugate gradient (CG) method with specified options.
Returns a generalized minimal residual (GMRES) method with specified options.
Returns a default least squares minimum residual (LSMR) method.
Returns a least squares minimum residual method with specified options.
Constants that specify the type of convergence test.
Options for creating a least squares minimum residual method.
The absolute tolerance (default test) or
tolerance (Fong-Saunders test).
The
tolerance (Fong-Saunders test only).
The condition number limit (Fong-Saunders test only).
The convergence test to use for iterative solve methods.
Returns a new LSMR options structure.
Returns a new LSMR options structure using the specified parameters.
The damping parameter lambda for regularized least squares.
The maximum number of iterations.
The number of vectors to use for local reorthogonalization.
An optional error-reporting routine.
An optional status-reporting routine.
The relative convergence tolerance (default test only).
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
